title: Adigvcdh
author: Adigvcdh
content: How do you think it is possible to raise a promising, but not having significant capital, project from the bottom and bring it to high heights in the world of cryptocurrencies? What strategies and actions can help to develop promising ideas without initially having huge resources?

comments.author: electronicash
comments.body: hard to see what to consider a promising project today since almost everything in crypto had already been explored from L1 and memecoin. suddenly we realized we missed out theres actually Layer Zero (L0)but there are redundant project with sneaky marketing that seem to have worked. the project still alive after crypto winter. Justin Sun did some stunts for that TRX.

comments.author: Wiwo

So the best possible thing to do is to avoid in totality whatever project that hnonot hard capital to build the projects and depend on crowdfunding to develop the projects,  such a mindset will only lead to disappointment for both the team developer and the investors.

comments.author: bastian466
comments.body: Everything requires capital, so you have to have creative marketing partners who can convince people to attract as many investors as possible to raise funds. because the power of investors is also very helpful in terms of capital. comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Quote from: Adigvcdh on November 19, 2023, 06:53:19 PMHow do you think it is possible to raise a promising, but not having significant capital, project from the bottom and bring it to high heights in the world of cryptocurrencies? What strategies and actions can help to develop promising ideas without initially having huge resources?The success of any project really comes down to having a killer idea first and foremost.  Let's be real - if your idea isn't truly innovative or exciting, no amount of smart strategies or hard work is gonna save it.  But a lack of major capital can definitely be a challenge too.  Don't get caught up in trying to do too much too soon; start small prove out your concept on a miniature scale first, then expand from there. And, most importantly, I hope your promising idea is not about building robots to colonize Mars, because that would be just stupid.

comments.author: Wexnident
comments.body: Quote from: Adigvcdh on November 19, 2023, 06:53:19 PMHow do you think it is possible to raise a promising, but not having significant capital, project from the bottom and bring it to high heights in the world of cryptocurrencies? What strategies and actions can help to develop promising ideas without initially having huge resources?A lot of work in terms of marketing and implementing SEO. Honestly, even a dog project could have great results if the marketing was done properly but said work requires a lot of time and resources plus you're also up against others in terms of trying to rank on top of each other in terms of searchability. If you're not in a rush then you can slowly develop the project together with it's community, start a youtube channel that showcases the development of said idea, whatever it is and slowly go from there. It takes time, yes, but as long as the project is even a little bit interesting, you should be able to get some followers at the very least. If it was bad, then don't expect much really.

comments.author: MAAManda
comments.body: Quote from: Adigvcdh on November 19, 2023, 06:53:19 PMHow do you think it is possible to raise a promising, but not having significant capital, project from the bottom and bring it to high heights in the world of cryptocurrencies? What strategies and actions can help to develop promising ideas without initially having huge resources?It's not possible to bring good ideas to crypto without using resources, think about how you would design everything without mass resources? are you sure you can do everything alone?Then, to create a successful product, of course you need adoption, how do people adopt without ever knowing about the product? the answer is marketing, and marketing requires resources (money).Do you think that projects like Aptos (APT), Oasis Network (ROSE), and many other altcoins fund their own development? Of course not, they have venture capital as their backers, who fund all forms of progress. If you have an idea in crypto that's a game changer, believe me, you will find people who will want to fund your project.

comments.body: Quote from: Adigvcdh on November 19, 2023, 06:53:19 PMHow do you think it is possible to raise a promising, but not having significant capital, project from the bottom and bring it to high heights in the world of cryptocurrencies? What strategies and actions can help to develop promising ideas without initially having huge resources?It’s really challenging to try to build a promising project in the world of cryptocurrencies without significant capital. It's a tough journey, but there are strategies that can help you develop your ideas without a massive budget. Building a successful cryptocurrency project takes time, dedication, and a passion for solving real-world problems with innovative technology. comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Quote from: Adigvcdh on November 19, 2023, 06:53:19 PMHow do you think it is possible to raise a promising, but not having significant capital, project from the bottom and bring it to high heights in the world of cryptocurrencies? What strategies and actions can help to develop promising ideas without initially having huge resources?We've seen many of projects starting small come online to ask for term members even before the projects are put together. It's crazy that someone gets random strangers to be on their projects, though. It's a telltale sign of scam waiting to happen. Sadly, not many people can pick up such sign.What most smart devs and their teams do to raise awareness if they don't have funds to play around and advertise their projects is to airdrop their tokens and then create room for referral bonuses so those recruited can recruit others. Some of them run bounties and then offer to pay hunters with their unlisted tokens. Those two techniques seem to work better than others with the developers not having to commit much capital to it.

comments.author: BitcoinPanther
comments.body: Quote from: Adigvcdh on November 19, 2023, 06:53:19 PMHow do you think it is possible to raise a promising, but not having significant capital, project from the bottom and bring it to high heights in the world of cryptocurrencies? What strategies and actions can help to develop promising ideas without initially having huge resources?Developers tend to go for crowdfunding.  It was very popular way of getting funds.  And for this crowdfunding to be successful, the project developer must be very knowledgeable in promoting and marketing their project.  They should also convince influential people into believing to their concept.It is all about advertisement and marketing.  Exposure and good impression is the key to cater investors.  The project should have a good communicator and efficient marketer and for a project to get noticed they need to invest more on marketing and advertisement and at the same time hunt for partners that can give benefit for the project in terms of exposure and influence.Quote from: Mpamaegbu on November 20, 2023, 02:20:32 PMWhat most smart devs and their teams do to raise awareness if they don't have funds to play around and advertise their projects is to airdrop their tokens and then create room for referral bonuses so those recruited can recruit others. Some of them run bounties and then offer to pay hunters with their unlisted tokens. Those two techniques seem to work better than others with the developers not having to commit much capital to it.Airdrop has proven to destroy the project's market if not planned carefully.  Instead of giving away the token and get collected by bots and get dumped the moment the project enters the market, I believe it is much better to look for investors giving them bonuses depending on their invested amount.  I agree with bounty campaign and compensate the advertisers with unlisted token but not airdrop because I think airdrop  is only a waste of fund.

comments.author: Webetcoins
comments.body: Quote from: Adigvcdh on November 19, 2023, 06:53:19 PMHow do you think it is possible to raise a promising, but not having significant capital, project from the bottom and bring it to high heights in the world of cryptocurrencies? What strategies and actions can help to develop promising ideas without initially having huge resources?By finding a few people who are intelligent and good at coming up with ideas about turning real-world scenarios into digital experiences and finding another set of people who are good at finding anything online so that the ideas that are brainstormed are searched to see if they already exist or have been tried or not, and then find some people who are good at crowdfunding and collecting funds for startups by creating campaigns that can convince and motivate people to put in their money into things that are just dreams but can become reality due to their contributions, and finally, find a set of people who can create and manage the project, all aspects of it, from the website, whitepaper to the management and press handling.Do you think you can do that?
